alert.note: Alert for East Slopes Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Jemez Mountains; Northern Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Southern Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Tusas Mountains Including Chama (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued March 14 at 3:46PM MDT until March 17 at 6:00AM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY EVENING THROUGH LATE THURSDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations generally between 8 and 12 inches with locally higher amounts above 10,000 feet. Winds could gust as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...Northern Mountains. * WHEN...From Wednesday evening through late Thursday night. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Some roads may be closed. Significant travel delays are possible. The hazardous conditions could impact the Wednesday evening and Thursday morning commutes.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.

area.areaDesc: East Slopes Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Jemez Mountains; Northern Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Southern Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Tusas Mountains Including Chama
